t: Isaiah 24
Judgment on the Earth
Behold,*p the Lord*s lays the earth waste, devastates it, distorts its surface and scatters its inhabitants.
And the people will be like the priest, the servant like his master, the maid like her mistress, the buyer like the seller, the lender like the borrower, the creditor like the debtor.
The earth will be completely laid waste and completely despoiled, for the Lord*s has spoken this word.
The earth mourns and*i withers, the world fades and*i withers, the exalted of the people of the earth fade away.
The earth is also polluted by its inhabitants, for they transgressed laws, violated statutes, broke the everlasting covenant.
Therefore, a curse devours the earth, and those who live in it are held guilty. Therefore, the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men are left.
The*pn new wine mourns, The*ln vine decays, All*ln the merry-hearted sigh.
The*ln gaiety of tambourines ceases, The*ln noise of revelers stops, The*ln gaiety of the harp ceases.
They*ln do not drink wine with song; Strong*ln drink is bitter to those who drink it.
The*ln city of chaos is broken down; Every*ln house is shut up so that none may enter.
There*ln is an outcry in the streets concerning the wine; All*ln joy turns to gloom. The*ln gaiety of the earth is banished.
Desolation*ln is left in the city And*ln the gate is battered to ruins.
For*ln thus it will be in the midst of the earth among the peoples, As*ln the shaking of an olive tree, As*ln the gleanings when the grape harvest is over.
They*ln raise their voices, they shout for joy; They*ln cry out from the west concerning the majesty of the Lord.*s
Therefore*ln glorify the Lord*s in the east, The*ln name of the Lord,*s the God of Israel, In*ln the coastlands of the sea.

From*ln the ends of the earth we hear songs, “Glory to the Righteous One,” But*ln I say, “Woe to me! Woe to me! Alas for me! The*ln treacherous deal treacherously, And*ln the treacherous deal very treacherously.”
Terror*ln and pit and snare Confront*ln you, O inhabitant of the earth.

Then*ln it will be that he who flees the report of disaster will fall into the pit, And*ln he who climbs out of the pit will be caught in the snare; For*ln the windows above are opened, and the foundations of the earth shake.
The*ln earth is broken asunder, The*ln earth is split through, The*ln earth is shaken violently.
The*ln earth reels to and fro like a drunkard And*ln it totters like a shack, For*ln its transgression is heavy upon it, And*ln it will fall, never to rise again.
So*ln it will happen in that day, That*ln the Lord*s will punish the host of heaven on high, And*ln the kings of the earth on earth.
They*ln will be gathered together Like*iln prisoners in the dungeon, And*ln will be confined in prison; And*ln after many days they will*i be*i punished.
Then*ln the moon will be abashed and the sun ashamed, For*ln the Lord*s of hosts will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, And*ln His*i glory will be before His elders.
